name: Indigenous Law
description: Seminar course exploring Indigenous law, settler state law, and the complex interrelationship between the two in Canada. Topics include: legal sources, forms and processes; sovereignty, territory and jurisdiction; treaty relationships; Indigenous peoples in international law; Indigenous rights and the constitution; environmental use, relations and protection; and Indigenous self-determination and governance.
department: Centre for Criminology and Sociolegal Studies
prerequisites: 1 FCE from CRI205H1, CRI210H1, CRI215H1, CRI225H1. 0.5 FCE from CRI 300-level
exclusions: CRI490H1 Advanced Topics in Criminology: Indigenous Law taken in 20169
